General Dynamics (GD) said Friday it was awarded three Navy contracts totaling $4.6 billion. A day earlier, President Obama signed a $633 billion defense bill, giving contractors a temporary reprieve from planned spending cuts.

Shares of the maker of computer networks, aircraft, submarines and defense systems fell slightly though as significant cuts to defense spending still loom despite the so-called fiscal cliff deal reached Wednesday.

General Dynamics said its Electric Boat subsidiary received the three contracts. It will begin design work on a new kind of submarine, and at the same time continue construction of Virginia-class attack submarines.

"These awards provide the stability to the submarine industrial base that will allow us to achieve even greater cost reduction through improved efficiencies ... ," Electric Boat President Kevin Poitras said in a statement.
General Dynamics shares were down 0.5% in late Friday afternoon trading.
The contracts could lift the company's results, which were lackluster last year.
Earnings per share for the past four quarters grew 3%, 1%, 0% and -2% last quarter. Analysts expect EPS to fall 5% this quarter. Its stock has a weak 66 Composite Rating, out of a best-possible 99.
The Congressional deal Wednesday postponed for two months a huge budget cut that includes a $54.7 billion reduction in military spending.

Defense Secretary Leon Panetta noted that "Unfortunately, the cloud of sequestration remains." The automatic budget cuts, called sequestration, are still due to go into effect on March 27 unless Congress reaches a new deal or raises the debt ceiling.
Aerospace giant Lockheed Martin (LMT) announced Thursday that it won a $755 mil contract for Patriot missiles, slated to run through July 31, 2015.
Rival Boeing (BA) on Wednesday said it received an $895 million Air Force contract to upgrade the C17 Globemaster military transport plane. Boeing will upgrade software, hardware and weapons systems.
Harris (HRS), an electronic systems maker, said Thursday that it had bagged multiple orders from the Air Force, worth a total $85 million, to supply Falcon tactical radios and other gear.
Boeing and Harris were up slightly Friday.

Shares of some of IBD's highest-rated military suppliers, TransDigm (TDG), which makes controls, ignition systems and other components for the aerospace industry, and Raytheon (RTN), which makes guidance systems for missiles and defense systems, were fractionally higher Friday.

Under its first contract, General Dynamics will be paid $1.85 billion for R&D work on the new class of ballistic-missile subs, slated for a 2021 construction start. Under a separate part of that contract, valued at about $2 billion, it will continue to develop a missile compartment for Ohio-class subs.
Under a second contract, Electric Boat will build two Virginia-class submarines, South Dakota and Delaware, the 17th and 18th ships in this class.

Its third agreement is a $308 million contract to buy materials to get work started on the as-yet unnamed Virginia-class submarines.General Dynamics (GD) said Friday it was awarded three Navy contracts totaling $4.6 billion. Stocks were slightly off session lows Tuesday afternoon, but were still stuck with fat losses of more than 1%. All of the major stock averages were suffering their biggest percentage losses of the year.

The Nasdaq and S&P 500 were down 1.5% each. The Dow Jones industrial average was also down 1.5%. Caterpillar (CAT) was the biggest loser in the price-weighted index. The stock has now fallen more than 8% below a 114.75 buy point from a cup-with-handle base. The stock never found strong volume when it crossed the buy point.
Turnover was again tracking sharply higher on both major exchanges.

Polaris Industries (PII) dropped nearly 4% in heavy trading, extending recent losses. The stock also breached its 50-day moving average and has wiped out gains from its January break. It's now just above a 63.16 buy point from a cup-with-handle base. Polaris was up as much as 11% past that buy point.

TransDigm (TDG) lost 3% in fast trade. The stock cleared a 119.51 buy point from a three-weeks-tight pattern Feb. 27, but volume was weak. TransDigm also closed poorly that day. It's now 6% below the trigger.

InvenSense (INVN) showed some relative strength as it fell less than 1%. The stock appeared to be finding support near its 50-day moving average. That's its first test of the line since clearing an IPO base Jan. 9. InvenSense shot up 62% past an 11.95 buy point before pulling back.
Every stock in the IBD 50 remained lower.

On the plus side, Shuffle Master (SHFL) was off its session peak, but still up a health 15% after beating views late Monday. The gaming equipment maker's latest quarterly earnings surged 56%, the best in seven quarters. Rockwell Collins (COL) reported fourth-quarter profit well above analyst estimates, but weak government sales hurt revenue.
The aerospace equipment maker said fourth-quarter earnings rose 17% to $1.32 per share, beating views by 20 cents. Sales dipped 2% to $1.27 bil, less than analyst estimates of $1.33 billion.
Shares rose 2% to 54.34 in early trading Friday.

"Market conditions in fiscal year 2012 were very challenging as customer bankruptcies, slower global economic recovery, and multiple defense order delays and cutbacks impacted our revenue growth," CEO Clay Jones said.
Sales at the commercial systems division, which provides aviation electronics systems, products and services to airlines, rose 9% to $565 million.
But sales at the government systems division fell 10% to $701 million.

"While we expect continued growth in 2013 from our strong commercial systems positions, the challenges in our defense business will remain, including the dramatic cuts to U.S. defense spending anticipated to go into effect in January," Jones said.
Collins' reiterated its 2013 EPS guidance of $4.30 to $4.50 it issued in September. Analysts are expecting $4.49.

Earlier this week Boeing (BA) and Pentagon contractor Lockheed Martin (LMT) reported jumps in earnings, but falling sales. Northrop Grumman (NOC) reported a drop in earnings but still beat analyst views.
The Aerospace/ Defense group is ranked No. 98 out of Investor's Business Daily's 197 industry groups.

Group leaders include TransDigm (TDG), DigitalGlobe (DGI), which is slated to report earnings on Oct. 30, and B/E Aerospace (BEAV).Rockwell Collins (COL) reported fourth-quarter profit well above analyst estimates, but weak government sales hurt revenue.The aerospace equipment maker said fourth-quarter earnings rose 17% to $1.32 per share, beating views by 20 cents. More highly rated stocks have staged breakouts or neared potential buy points this week. It's just what you want to see with a market uptrend. Spirit,…
A day-to-day check of the current market continues to show that the quantity and quality of stock breakouts are rising.
While a few names are in final preparations for a breakout, others have rushed past prime buy points and not looked back.
This, coupled with the upward trend of the Nasdaq and the NYSE composite, tells the disciplined investor that conditions for buying leading stocks are good.

SolarWinds (SWI), a Web-based provider of computer networking tools, has built a seven-week base. At just 3% off a 33.68 high, the stock is in position to either rally past a 33.78 buy point or perhaps form a handle. If a handle forms, it must be at least five days long. Trading should ideally calm down, signifying a lack of selling pressure in the handle area.

Copa Holdings (CPA), the highly profitable and fast-growing regional airline based in Panama, is challenging old resistance around 70. The weekly chart shows its struggles at that price level in July, October and November.
Copa's Transportation-Airlines group is a leader, No. 22 as of Thursday's IBD vs. No. 80 six weeks ago.

Manhattan Associates (MANH) cleared a seven-week cup without handle at 46.72 in double normal volume on Thursday. With an average volume of just 154,000 shares, risk is higher for investors. However, a great stock often sees its average turnover balloon over time as the rally takes shape.
The supply chain management software firm boasts EPS increases of 55%, 76% and 58% in the past three quarters. The Composite Rating is a top-notch 99.
DealerTrack (TRAK) cleared a 28.90 square-box buy point. Its average volume of 261,000 shares is light.

TransDigm (TDG), Triumph Group (TGI) and Plains All American (PAA) have broken out and are extended. Stocks moved back and forth within narrowly mixed territory Monday as blue chips continued to lag.

The Nasdaq and S&P 500 climbed 0.3% and 0.2%, respectively. But the Dow Jones industrial average was fractionally lower. IBM (IBM) was the Dow's biggest loser after announcing a deal to buy software maker Kenexa (KNXA) for $1.3 billion.

Nationstar Mortgage (NSM) bounced back from a 5% loss and turned fractionally higher. The stock is now on pace to snap a six-session losing streak. Earlier this month, the mortgage servicer delivered Q2 earnings that soared 1,950% to 41 cents and sales that grew 143% to $200 million.

Calumet Speciality Products Partners (CLMT) rallied 4% to its best levels in more than four years. The stock is now 11% past a 25.72 buy point from a cup-with-handle base cleared Aug. 15. Calumet processes crude oil into lubricants, solvents, waxes and other petroleum-based products. Analysts see its profit surging 223% to $3.17 a share this year.Stocks moved back and forth within narrowly mixed territory Monday as blue chips continued to lag.The Nasdaq and S&P 500 climbed 0.3% and 0.2%, respectively. But the Dow Jones industrial average was fractionally lower. IBM (IBM) was the Dow's biggest loser after announcing a deal to buy software maker Kenexa (KNXA) for $1.3 billion.Turnover was again tracking lower on both major exchanges.Universal Display (PANL) was off its session low, but still down 9% in huge trade. Shares had been off by as much as 14% on worries over sales to Samsung, which lost a patent-infringement suit to Apple (AAPL). Universal Display is a Samsung supplier.Stratasys (SSYS) reversed early gains and fell 3% in heavy trading. The stock is on pace for its fourth loss in the past five sessions. Stratasys went on a tear after breaking out from a cup-with-handle base July 18, but has since pulled back after reversing from a record high last week. It is still 12% past a 54.47 buy point.Nationstar Mortgage (NSM) bounced back from a 5% loss and turned fractionally higher. The stock is now on pace to snap a six-session losing streak. Amazon.com (AMZN) after the close took a beating after delivering mixed Q4 results. The company's earnings easily topped views, but sales missed. Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN) took the biggest hit among Sector Leaders for the second straight day, falling 3.09, or 3%, to 100.94 in more than double its average daily volume. The stock has fallen for four straight sessions…
Stocks slumped in early trading Tuesday following a raft of dismal quarterly results from some of the biggest names in American industry, including DuPont (DD) and 3M (MMM).
The Dow Jones industrial average and the S&P 500 both fell 1.3%, while the Nasdaq composite was off 1%. Volume was running sharply higher than at the same time Monday.
TransDigm (TDG), an IBD 50 member, gapped down sharply and sank more than 10% early but shaved its loss to nearly 3% in below-average trade. The stock briefly undercut a 136.44 buy point.

The aircraft components firm fell after industrial giant United Technologies (UTX) traded wildly in the early going after reporting Q3 earnings of $1.37 a share, down 2% year over year but well above the $1.18 consensus forecast. The stock was down as much as 2% early but cut the loss to less than 1%.
United Technologies, the maker of aircraft engines, Otis elevators and other heavy duty equipment, cited a smaller than expected share dilution related to a recent acquisition.

3M fell nearly 3% after it matched the consensus view on the bottom line with earnings up 9% to $1.65 a share. But the St. Paul, Minn.-based firm missed the top line estimate as third-quarter sales edged lower to $7.5 billion. It also shaved profit guidance due to the limp economic recovery.

The maker of Post-It notes, traffic sign coatings, Scotch tape and other household, office and industrial products said it expects to earn $6.27 to $6.35 per share for the year, down from a prior forecast of $6.35 to $6.50. The Street view was $6.40. Revenue will be roughly flat.
Chemicals titan DuPont gapped down more than 8% after reporting Q3 profit excluding one-time items of 32 cents a share, down more than 50% vs. a year ago and sharply below the consensus estimate.
Sales fell sharply to $7.4 billion, sharply below the $8.15 billion forecast. The company plans to shave 1,500 jobs. DuPont had been working on a shallow saucer base since early May.

On the upside, ARM Holdings (ARMH) surged nearly 8% in heavy trade. The mixed-signal chip designer posted revenue growth of 18% to $228 million, a quarterly record and an acceleration from 12% growth in Q2. It earned 3.71 pence per share.
The stock moved past a 29.29 buy point in a long cup with handle.

Coach (COH) jumped nearly 5% after it said September-ended quarter earnings grew 5.5% to 77 cents a share, a penny above the consensus forecast but the smallest increase since a 6% increase in the June 2011 quarter. Revenue rose at a faster rate of 11% to $1.16 billion.
The luxury handbag and accessories maker and retailer announced a share buyback of up to $1.5 billion by June 30, 2015.
The stock has been struggling in 2012 and is more than 30% below an all-time high of 79.70. Its Relative Price Strength Rating is a poor 13.

In economic news, the ICSC-Goldman weekly report showed same-store sales at major retail chains fell 0.7% vs. the prior week but were up 2.9% year over year. IBD 50 stocks started 2012 on a positive note, gaining ground in the first week of the new year. They rose 1.4% on average for the week. Meanwhile, the Nasdaq climbed 2.7% for the week, the S&P 500 1.6% and the NYSE 1.1%. There weren't many breakouts by IBD 50 stocks during the past week. Advance Auto Parts (AAP) managed…
Stocks were near session highs midday Tuesday after charging out of gate. Better-than-expected economic data at home and in China boosted the major averages on this first trading day of 2012.

The Nasdaq rallied 2.1% and touched its 200-day moving average. The S&P 500 climbed and Dow Jones industrial average was also up 2%. Caterpillar (CAT) and IBM (IBM) were among the Dow's biggest point gainers. Volume continued to track sharply higher across the board.

Bankrate (RATE) was off its session high, but still up 4% in heavy trading. At about two hours into the session, the stock has already traded more than half of its average daily volume. Earlier, the stock hit a new high after clearing a 22.04 buy point in a base on base. The provider of financial information lost money in 2009 and 2010, but is expected to turn a profit for 2011.

Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) rose 3% to an all-time high in fast trade. It cleared a 341.38 buy point in a third-stage cup-with-handle base. The structure is the second half of a base-on-base pattern. On Tuesday, Deutsche Bank upgraded shares to buy from hold.
Despite the market's gains, some leaders turned tail.
TransDigm (TDG) turned a 3% gain into a near 1% loss. But the stock appeared to be finding support near its 50-day moving average. The stock is a first-stage base on base with a 102.83 buy point.
Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) also reversed lower, turning a 2% gain into a 2% loss. The reversal put the stock back below a 67.52 buy point from a cup-with-handle base.

Stocks continued to hold in slightly positive territory at midafternoon Friday, as they digested Thursday's solid advance.

The Nasdaq added 0.2%, while the Dow Jones industrial average and S&P 500 both edged up less than 0.1%. Options expirations boosted volume, which was up from Thursday's level for the NYSE, but was down for the Nasdaq.

For the week, the Nasdaq is on track to gain 1.6% and to extend its winning streak to five straight weeks. The S&P 500 is set to move up 0.7% for the week; the Dow, 0.4%. The latter two indexes would each have a six-week winning streak.
Several leading stocks were making strong moves.

Apple (AAPL) advanced 1% in fast trade, hitting a new all-time high and moving further past a 619.97 buy point from a cup-with-handle pattern it cleared earlier this month. The stock is now trading at the upper end of a buy zone established by that entry at 619.97. The zone extends to 650.97.

Apple got a lift Friday from a Jefferies analyst who raised his price target for the stock to 900. A smaller iPad and new Apple TV device are now in production, the analyst said in a research note Friday.

Michael Kors (KORS) jumped 6% in heavy turnover. The apparel maker is moving more decisively past a 49.60 cup buy point. Kors was trading 5% past 49.60 after holding near the buy point the past three days.
TransDigm Group (TDG) climbed 4% in fast trade, breaking out of a flat base with a 136.44 buy point. The buying range for the aircraft components maker's latest base extends to 5% past 136.44.

Francesca's Holdings (FRAN) surged 9% in huge volume, clearing a 32.69 buy point from a cup-with-handle base. The clothing retailer, which went public in 2011, is trading 3% past 32.69, meaning it's in a possible buying range.

On the downside, Hibbett Sports (HIBB) shed 3% in strong turnover, although it has bounced back from a loss of 11% out of the gate and regained its 50-day moving average. Before the opening bell, the sporting goods retailer said second-quarter EPS rose 43% to 30 cents, beating views, but revenue grew 8% to $165 million, missing estimates.
Hibbett also hiked its full-year EPS target range to $2.57-$2.67, but the midpoint for that range was below views. The stock has a strong IBD Composite Rating of 94 out of a best-possible 99.

Friday's economic reports were coming in better than expected. The University of Michigan reported its Consumer Sentiment Index rose to 73.6 in August, topping forecasts for 72 and July's reading of 72.3. Leading economic indicators rose 0.4% in July, according to the Conference Board, reversing June's 0.3% decline and besting estimates for a 0.2% gain.Stocks continued to hold in slightly positive territory at midafternoon Friday, as they digested Thursday's solid advance.The Nasdaq added 0.2%, while the Dow Jones industrial average and S&P 500 both edged up less than 0.1%. The Nasdaq rallied 1.2% and closed back above the 2700 level. The S&P 500 also gained 1.2%. It also ended back above its 200-day moving average. The Dow Jones industrial average rose 0.8%. McDonald's (MCD) closed a touch lower after making a new high. Volume rose across the board.

Priceline.com (PCLN) bolted 9% to its highest level since Sept. 20. Volume was almost three times its average and the highest in more than three months. The stock scored its biggest percentage gain in more than a year as investors overlooked a soft Q4 profit outlook. Late Monday the company topped expectations as it reported an 87% surge in Q3 profit and a 45% gain in sales.

Rackspace Hosting (RAX) motored 7.5% to a near four-month high in huge trade. Late Monday, the website hosting and cloud-computing firm delivered a 56% jump in Q3 earnings, matching expectations. Sales, which topped views, grew 32%.

TransDigm (TDG) rallied 4% to an all-time high in nearly twice its average trade. The stock cleared a 95.14 buy point in a four-month consolidation. TransDigm agreed to buy aircraft parts maker Harco Laboratories for about $84 million.
Cardtronics (CATM) ended off its session high, but still gained 9% in huge trade in reaction to Monday's Q3 results. It cleared a 25.95 buy point in a cup-with-handle base.
Accretive Health (AH), Advance Auto Parts (AAP), Cisco Systems (CSCO) and Silver Wheaton (SLW) are among the notable companies reporting earnings Wednesday.

Boeing (BA) landed a $7.2 billion order to provide Air Lease (AL) with 75 of its redesigned MAX 737 jetliners over the next several years, a win for the aerospace giant as it vies with archrival Airbus for orders.
The Boeing-Air Lease accord was one of the biggest of a batch announced at the Farnborough Airshow in England on Monday.
Others included a $7.3 billion order by the U.S military for Black Hawk helicopters over five years from Sikorsky Aircraft, a unit of defense provider United Technologies (UTX).
Air Lease, a Los Angeles company that buys planes and leases them to airlines, also took the option to buy 23 more planes if demand rises.
Boeing Commercial Airplanes CEO Ray Conner said of the Air Lease contract, "They are an ideal partner to help establish the 737 MAX in the leasing market."
Conner said Boeing's products are performing above par.
"We're seeing levels of demonstrated performance that give us confidence in our ability to increase production rates and deliver on our promises to customers," Conner said in a written statement.
Earlier this month, Airbus announced plans to build an assembly plant in Mobile, Ala., its first U.S. factory. The plant is expected to employ 1,000 at build-out.
Airbus CEO Fabrice Bregier said after announcing the plant that it could help double the company's U.S. market share in the next five years.

In other activity, defense contractor Raytheon (RTN), which makes missile guidance and other systems, said it won a $636 million contract to continue work on Exoatmospheric Kill Vehicle (EKV), the main component of the U.S. missile defense program. Boeing awarded Raytheon the contract, with runs through 2018.

Bloomberg, citing unnamed sources, reported Mexico's top airline Grupo Aeromexico is near a deal to buy 70 jetliners from either Boeing or Airbus. Boeing sent a sales team to Mexico to secure the contract, the report said.
Boeing shares rose 0.5% to 74.02 in afternoon trading. Raytheon advanced 0.9% to 56.37.

Elsewhere in the Aerospace/Defense group, ranked No. 107 of the 197 industry groups IBD tracks, highly rated Transdigm Group (TDG), which make actuators, controls and other components for the aerospace industry, climbed 0.4% to 131.41. Vitamins, pharmaceuticals and aircraft actuators have little in common. But companies that make or sell those varied products are flashing healthy signals, outperforming the broader market.

The Relative Strength line measures a stock's pull vs. the S&P 500. With the market in an uptrend, this helps investors separate the rally's leaders from coattail riders. Here are five IBD 50 stocks with strong fundamentals and RS lines bolting higher, from the Screen of the Day.

Mellanox Technologies (MLNX) is an Israeli maker of products that speed up high-bandwidth transmission of data between servers and data storage systems. Its shares got a boost last month when it said Intel (INTC) had selected its technology for new, high-performance server platforms.
The No. 7 firm on the IBD 50 will release second-quarter results on July 18.
Shares were up 2% Monday to 72.32, on top of a 17% run-up last month.

GNC Holdings (GNC), the vitamin and supplements retailer, has relied on new product offerings to keep customers coming back. It posted 15.8% growth at U.S. company-owned stores open at least a year in the first quarter, its 27th straight quarterly gain.
The No. 4 company on the IBD 50 list climbed 4.8% Monday to 41.08, and was up 1.7% in June.

TransDigm Group (TDG) makes pumps, controls, actuators and other components that are key to keeping military and commercial jets in the air. Airlines retiring older jets have raised concerns about its aftermarket parts business. But many carriers are replacing them with more fuel-efficient models from Boeing (BA) or European rival Airbus, keeping TransDigm's new-parts orders strong.
The No. 8 firm on the IBD 50 list reached a new high early in the session Monday, but reversed lower and closed down 1.75% at 131.95. Shares climbed 9.2% in June.

SXC Health Solutions (SXCI), the pharmacy benefit manager, on Monday completed its $4.4 billion cash-and-stock acquisition of rival Catalyst Health Solutions. The deal creates the fourth-largest PBM by prescription volume, covering about 25 million members.
SXC, No. 2 on the IBD 50 list, also touched a new high Monday before reversing for a 2.25% decline, closing at 96.98. Shares were up 10.6% in June.

Alexion Pharmaceuticals' (ALXN) sole approved drug, Soliris, treats some rare blood diseases. But sales have been strong, climbing 47% in the first quarter from a year earlier. It's working on clearance to market the drug for other rare disorders as well.

The No. 3 on the IBD 50 list surged to a new high Monday and closed near there at 103.83, up 4.6% for the day. General Electric (GE) agreed to buy Italy's privately held Avio for $4.3 billion amid consolidation in the aerospace industry.
The buyout would help consolidate GE's supply chain because Avio manufactures components for GE's Dreamliner engine used by Boeing (BA) in its jet airliner.

It's also a sign of confidence in Europe's fourth-largest economy, even though the region is still mired in a debt crisis. Italy's Prime Minister Mario Monti — who earlier approved a reform agenda — was due to step down Friday, ahead of expected general elections in February.
GE shares fell 1.4% to 20.76 in Friday afternoon trading.
The diversified manufacturer has traded in a narrow range the last few months, and Friday afternoon was trading just above its 200-day moving average and slightly below its 50-day average.
Rivals United Technologies (UTX) and Honeywell (HON) both fell less than 1%.
Meanwhile, Europe's instability has led some diversified manufacturers to cut back or sell some businesses.

Netherlands-based ArcelorMittal (MT), the world's largest steel maker, said Friday it will write down the value of its European business by $4.3 billion, underscoring Europe's economic woes. ArcelorMittal was down 3.7% Friday afternoon.
And France's Peugeot, the second-largest European carmaker, generated a firestorm among workers in July when it announced it would close a plant in the suburbs of Paris.

GE beat out France's Safran and Italy's state-backed Strategic Fund with its offer to buy Avio's aviation parts business from private equity fund Cinven and Italian state-controlled defense company Finmeccanica. GE is not buying Avio's space unit, which Italy considers to be in a strategic industry.
Highly rated aircraft parts maker TransDigm Group (TDG) has grown rapidly recently via a series of deals both big and small.

Since August 2011, it's spent more than $1.1 billion on four purchases. The latest was in September, when TransDigm bought AeroInstruments, a maker of air data sensors, flight test equipment and other gear, for $35 million.
TransDigm eased 0.6% Friday afternoon.

Among other large companies in the Aerospace/Defense group, ranked a middling 90 on IBD's list of 197 industries, Lockheed Martin (LMT) rose 0.5% while Precision Castparts (PCP) and General Dynamics (GD) both dipped about 0.5%.General Electric (GE) agreed to buy Italy's privately held Avio for $4.3 billion amid consolidation in the aerospace industry.The buyout would help consolidate GE's supply chain because Avio manufactures components for GE's Dreamliner engine used by Boeing (BA) in its jet airliner.It's also a sign of confidence in Europe's fourth-largest economy, even though the region is still mired in a debt crisis. Priceline (PCLN) tops the list of IBD 50 companies that are set to report earnings this week as investors look for some good news to rebound from disappointing economic data earlier.The other companies on deck include TransDigm (TDG), Discovery Communications (DISCA) and Fossil (FOSL). The IBD 50 is a list of top growth stocks with top fundamentals and strong relative price strength.TransDigm, an aircraft parts maker, reports Tuesday and has posted accelerating earnings growth for three straight quarters, with gains climbing from 24% to 38%, 42% and 65%.Analysts expect Q2 profit of $1.46 a share, up 50.5% from a year ago. Aerospace suppliers have benefited from growing demand for passenger aircraft, especially in emerging markets.Discovery Communications also reports Tuesday and has notched four consecutive quarters of accelerating profit growth, helped by a lineup of programming with broad appeal across markets.The top provider of "edu-tainment" content, including Animal Planet and Discovery Channel, is expected to earn 60 cents a share in Q2, a 22% increase from a year ago.Fossil is due on Tuesday as well, and analysts see the watchmaker reporting a Q1 profit of 92 cents a share, up 7%. The company has been helped by the renewed popularity of a fashion accessory that was feared would sink into obsolescence with the rise of mobile phones.It also licenses and markets models from Armani, Michael Kors (KORS), DKNY, Burberry and Adidas, and wealthier consumers in Asia have been eager to show off such brands.Priceline will report Wednesday, and expectations are high for another solid quarter of double-digit earnings and revenue growth. Analysts see profit jumping 48% to $3.94 a share.Last quarter, the online travel agency easily topped forecasts on global hotel bookings, especially in Asia and other new markets, which have made up for weakness in Europe.Late last month, rival Expedia (EXPE) reported better-than-expected quarterly results. Last week, Expedia spinoff TripAdvisor (TRIP), an ad-supported user reviews site, also trounced analyst forecasts.

The market correction continues to hammer even the most resilient stocks. But Your Weekly Review still carries a sizable number of highly-rated names bucking the decline.Fast drops by issues including 3D Systems (DDD) and TransDigm (TDG) this week have been a common refrain. When a stock makes a sharp pullback in heavy volume, it's not the time to be a hero.Instead, wait for evidence of solid institutional support. Note those stocks that build good bases even as the major indexes founder.So, what are some names showing true strength lately?The RV makers have been on a roll. Thor Industries (THO) is no exception. Even though the Jackson Center, Ohio-based firm has fallen six of the past seven sessions, see its weekly chart. The stock still enjoys a large air pocket above its fast-rising 10-week moving average.The stock, which carries a 92 EPS Rating and a 96 RS, has yet to touch that 10-week line since clearing a 33.90 cup-with-handle entry.PolyOne (POL) and Ingredion (INGR), a maker of starches and liquid sweeteners, have been acting in similar fashion to Thor. Ingredion is down for the week but that follows four straight weeks of big gains.The accelerating downside volume in PolyOne deserves genuine concern. Since late July, however, the polymer and resin maker has enjoyed strong support several times at its 10-week line.Leggett & Platt (LEG) is arguably going through a second rebound off the 10-week line. The furniture maker is just 3% past a four-weeks-tight follow-on entry at 25.40.Sherwin-Williams (SHW) is rebounding back above the 10-week moving average. Watch for a new base to form.Myriad Genetics (MYGN) and  DaVita (DVA) should not be ignored, even though they are extended. The former is showing good action after roaring out of a base-on-base formation at 28.68. The latter is showing tight weekly closes and working on nine straight up weeks.

Boeing Co. (BA) scored its biggest-ever order with a deal to sell 230 737s to Indonesia's Lion Air, adding to other hefty orders announced earlier this week.
The aerospace giant's new pact includes 201 737 MAX models with more efficient engines that won't be ready for delivery for several years as well as 29 extended-range 737-900 models.
The list prices for all the aircraft total $21.7 billion, but manufacturers typically provide discounts. The airline also has the option for 150 more planes.
Shares edged up less than 1% in early afternoon trading as stocks overall sold off.

Aerospace supplier Transdigm Group (TDG), which also reported earnings Thursday, edged higher. But Triumph Group (TGI) was fractionally lower while Rockwell Collins (COL), Precision Castparts (PCP) and L3 Communications (LLL) fell modestly.

Boeing's Lion Air order coincides with President Obama's visit to Indonesia and comes as the Chicago-based company wraps up the Dubai Air Show, during which it matched rival Airbus in the number of order wins.

Earlier this week, Emirate Airlines announced an order for 50 wide-body 777s with a list price totalling $18 billion and options for 20 more jets. Boeing also said Thursday that Singapore Airlines is the previously undisclosed buyer of eight 777s.

The orders are seen as the beginning of a wave of increased passenger-jet buying from emerging economies, as a growing middle class boosts business and leisure travel. Airlines in developed economies are also planning to refresh their fleets with more fuel-efficient models.

Boeing recently raised its 20-year outlook for commercial aircraft, due largely to expected demand from Asia. It now sees airlines buying 33,500 new jetliners worth $4 trillion through 2030, up from its forecast last year of 30,900 planes worth $3.6 trillion through 2029.

The aerospace sector is typically the top U.S. exporter and large orders like Boeing's could continue propping up manufacturing even as Europe sinks back into recession.Boeing Co. The blood and sacrifice of the U.S. military force over the years has made the nation a military superpower. However, while we pay homage to our heroes on the occasion of Memorial Day, we should also respect the contribution of the U.S. Aerospace and Defense industry to the economy.  We dig deeper into the industry and highlight why some top picks could not earn you smart gains ahead.Geopolitical RisksInvestors should note that with geopolitical uncertainty on the rise, developed as well as emerging nations have been increasing their defense spending. A stressed relationship between the United States and North Korea has long been a hot affair.On Thursday, the White House called off the planned Jun 12 meeting in Singapore due to North Korea’s “tremendous anger and open hostility” targeted toward Washington. Though in response to the cancellation of the meeting, Kim Jong Un made comments in a peacemaking tone, sensing a possible warfare, defense stocks went northward.Added to this, the Iran deal was suspended a few days back. There is tension related to the civil war in Syria. All these have given a boost to defense stocks (read: Defense Stocks Rally on Iran Deal: 4 Hot Picks).Trump BumpTrump’s victory in the U.S. Presidential election in Nov 2016 provided a boost to the defense sector due to his proposals for a massive increase in defense spending. He is expected to boost U.S. military spending considerably. Plus, the intrinsic strength of the stocks in this space is worthy of mention.Greater Mergers and Acquisitions The Aerospace and Defense sector is thriving with mergers and acquisitions. An analysis by Capstone Headwaters revealed that the amount of activities within the aerospace and defense world rose 2% in 2017 compared with a 16% decline the prior year. Among the hot deals, there was a $30-billion deal between United Technologies and the avionics and interiors maker Rockwell Collins. Boeing also announced its acquisition of advanced aerospace and autonomous systems manufacturer Aurora Flight Sciences in October 2017.Superb EarningsAerospace, which accounts for a meager 1.7% of the S&P 500 index, came up with impressive beat ratios in the Q1 reporting cycle. All companies have reported earnings in this season, with 90.9% companies beating earnings estimates while 81.8% surpassing the top line.The space posted a 37.8% surge in earnings in Q1 on 7.8% revenue growth. The scenario should be steady in Q2 with a likely earnings growth rate of 17.6% on 4.2% revenue growth, as per the Earnings Trends issued on May 23, 2018.Strong Sector FundamentalsGrowing civilian demand thanks to an improving global economy, aging commercial aircraft and the consequent rise in aircraft orders, a pickup in defense spending in certain other countries including Brazil, India and Saudi Arabia plus technological innovation and acquisitions have brightened the appeal for the sector.Stocks to PlayAgainst this backdrop, below we highlight a few top-ranked defense stocks that could fatten your portfolio.Wesco Aircraft Holdings Inc. (WAIR  -  Free Report)The Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) company distributes and provides supply chain management services to the global aerospace industry. It comes from a top-ranked Zacks sector (top 50%). The stock gained about 2.7% on May 24.AeroVironment Inc. (AVAV  -  Free Report)The Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) company designs, develops, produces, operates a portfolio of products and services for government agencies, businesses and consumers. It belongs to a top-ranked Zacks industry (top 43%). The stock gained about 2.5% on May 24. You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.Kratos Defense & Security Solutions Inc. (KTOS  -  Free Report)The Zacks Rank #1 company is a specialized National Security Technology business providing mission critical products, services and solutions for United States National Security priorities. The company hails from a top-ranked Zacks industry (top 43%). The stock gained about 1.2% on May 24.Transdigm Group Inc. (TDG  -  Free Report)The Zacks Rank #2 company is a leading global producer and supplier of highly engineered aircraft components for use on nearly all commercial and military aircraft in service. The company belongs to a top-ranked Zacks industry (top 43%). The stock gained about 0.5% on May 24.Looking for Stocks with Skyrocketing Upside?Zacks has just released a Special Report on the booming investment opportunities of legal marijuana.     Ignited by new referendums and legislation, this industry is expected to blast from an already robust $6.7 billion to $20.2 billion in 2021. The Guggenheim S&P 500 Equal Weight Industrials ETF (RGI  -  Free Report) made its debut on 11/01/2006, and is a smart beta exchange traded fund that provides broad exposure to the Industrials ETFs category of the U.S. equity market.What Are Smart Beta ETFs?Products that are based on market cap weighted indexes, which are strategies designed to reflect a specific market segment or the market as a whole, have traditionally dominated the ETF industry.A good option for investors who believe in market efficiency, market cap weighted indexes offer a low-cost, convenient, and transparent way of replicating market returns.If you're the kind of investor who would rather try and beat the market through good stock selection, then smart beta funds are your best choice; this fund class is known for tracking non-cap weighted strategies.By attempting to pick stocks that have a better chance of risk-return performance, non-cap weighted indexes are based on certain fundamental characteristics, or a combination of such.While this space offers a number of choices to investors, including simplest equal-weighting, fundamental weighting and volatility/momentum based weighting methodologies, not all these strategies have been able to deliver superior results.Fund Sponsor & IndexManaged by Invesco Powershares, RGI has amassed assets over $303.93 M, making it one of the average sized ETFs in the Industrials ETFs. Before fees and expenses, this particular fund seeks to match the performance of the S&P 500 Equal Weight Industrials Index.This index is an unmanaged equal weighted version of the S&P 500 Industrials Index that consists of the common stocks of the following industries: aerospace & defense, building products, construction & engineering, electrical equipment, conglomerates, machinery; commercial services & supplies, air freight & logistics, airlines, marine, road & rail transportation infrastructure.Cost & Other ExpensesExpense ratios are an important factor in the return of an ETF and in the long-term, cheaper funds can significantly outperform their more expensive cousins, other things remaining the same.Operating expenses on an annual basis are 0.40% for RGI, making it on par with most peer products in the space.It has a 12-month trailing dividend yield of 1.19%.Sector Exposure and Top HoldingsIt is important to delve into an ETF's holdings before investing despite the many upsides to these kinds of funds like diversified exposure, which minimizes single stock risk. And, most ETFs are very transparent products that disclose their holdings on a daily basis.RGI's heaviest allocation is in the Industrials sector, which is about 100% of the portfolio.Looking at individual holdings, Transdigm Group Inc (TDG  -  Free Report) accounts for about 1.71% of total assets, followed by Textron Inc (TXT  -  Free Report) and Csx Corp (CSX  -  Free Report).Its top 10 holdings account for approximately 15.84% of RGI's total assets under management.Performance and RiskRGI has lost about -0.94% so far this year, and as of 05/21/2018, is up roughly 16.70% in the last one year. In the past 52-week period, the fund has traded between $105.03 and $127.83.RGI has a beta of 1.10 and standard deviation of 14.89% for the trailing three-year period, which makes the fund a medium choice in the space. With about 70 holdings, it effectively diversifies company-specific risk.AlternativesGuggenheim S&P 500 Equal Weight Industrials ETF is an excellent option for investors seeking to outperform the Industrials ETFs segment of the market. There are other ETFs in the space which investors could consider as well.Vanguard Industrials ETF (VIS  -  Free Report) tracks MSCI US Investable Market Industrials 25/50 Index and the Industrial Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLI  -  Free Report) tracks Industrial Select Sector Index. Vanguard Industrials ETF has $3.81 B in assets, Industrial Select Sector SPDR Fund has $13.05 B. VIS has an expense ratio of 0.10% and XLI charges 0.13%.Investors looking for cheaper and lower-risk options should consider traditional market cap weighted ETFs that aim to match the returns of the Industrials ETFs.Bottom LineTo learn more about this product and other ETFs, screen for products that match your investment objectives and read articles on latest developments in the ETF investing universe, please visit Zacks ETF Center.

TransDigm Group Incorporated (TDG  -  Free Report) managed to impress investors with its recent earnings streak as the company’s bottom line trumped estimates thrice in the trailing four quarters. We believe that the company’s strong operational efficiency, its solid portfolio of products as well as complementary acquisitions will continue to be key growth drivers, going forward.The company’s stock has had an impressive run on the bourse in the past three months, driven by some impressive growth boosters. The stock has rallied 17.4%, ahead of the industry’s growth of 2.5%. We believe that the company’s encouraging traction across markets and a robust product portfolio will propel growth. Read on to find out the key catalysts for the company right now.Factors at PlayTransDigm’s excellent business operation model, which implements value-based operating strategies guided by three value driver concepts, has helped the company generate sufficient organic and inorganic growth, expanding the operating margin over the past few quarters.Moreover, through its well-diversified business, the company offers a broad range of products to its customers. Notably, it designs, produces and supplies highly engineered proprietary aerospace components and certain systems, commanding a significant aftermarket presence. For instance, 90% of TransDigm’s net sales is generated from the proprietary engineered products the intellectual property right of which, the company owns and enjoys to enhance its competitive edge. Also, the company is the sole supplier of more than three-fourth of products that it sells. This in turn, cements its assertive foothold in the market quite meaningfully.Further, we believe that stable aftermarkets, which have historically produced higher gross margins, will continue to leverage the company’s financial performance in the upcoming quarters. Of late, this Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) player’s defense business has also been steady enough to consistently add to its strength.This apart, the company’s acquisition strategies are directed toward buying proprietary aerospace businesses with substantial aftermarket content. This tactical move has in fact, already helped TransDigm strengthen its footprint in the core markets and grab a higher market share. In this regard, the company during fiscal 2017, had announced the buyout of three add-on aerospace product lines for a total consideration of roughly $100 million.We are also highly optimistic about TransDigm’s consolidations of Kirkhill and Extant in March 2018. Both companies are primarily proprietary sole source aerospace businesses with sizeable aftermarket content. Such strategic transactions are expected to be accretive to the acquirer’s product portfolio and contribute to its long-term growth.Other Stocks to ConsiderOther top-ranked stocks in the same space include AeroVironment, Inc. (AVAV  -  Free Report), CPI Aerostructures, Inc. (CVU  -  Free Report) and KLX Inc. (KLXI  -  Free Report). While AeroVironment sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), CPI Aerostructures and KLX carry a Zacks Rank of 2. You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.AeroVironment surpassed estimates in three of the trailing four quarters with an average positive earnings surprise of 147.4%.CPI Aerostructures exceeded estimates thrice in the last four quarters with an average beat of 20.1%.KLX outpaced estimates thrice in the preceding four quarters with an average earnings surprise of 10.6%.5 Medical Stocks to Buy NowZacks names 5 companies poised to ride a medical breakthrough that is targeting cures for leukemia, AIDS, muscular dystrophy, hemophilia, and other conditions.New products in this field are already generating substantial revenue and even more wondrous treatments are in the pipeline. In a not so surprising move on May 8, the United States withdrew from the historic deal designed to contain Iran’s nuclear program. Further, a spate of other sanctions is likely to be slapped on the Middle Eastern country. President Trump has characterized the Iran nuclear agreement as a “horrible one-sided deal that should have never, ever been made.”However, since the deal was suspended, defense stocks have rallied, primarily due to international geopolitical tensions that such developments give rise to. Investors can make the most of this opportunity to bet on the top defense stocks for alluring returns.Geopolitical Tensions Post Trump’s AnnouncementQuite expectedly, the sanctions and a complete annulment of the deal hasn’t gone down too well with Iran. The country has openly criticized such a decision by Trump, with its president Hassan Rouhani stating that Iran choses to stay in the deal even without the United States.Adding to the already tense environment, state-governed media from Syria reported on the afternoon of May 8 that Israel had fired missiles on sites near Damascus that are linked to Iran. Further, Saudi Arabia stated on May 9 that its air force had neutralized two more ballistic missiles over its city Riyadh, apparently fired by Houthi rebels from Yemen.Analysts fear that if the nuclear deal is not kept alive till the end of this year and if U.S. reimposes sanctions that were already in effect before the deal, the situation may worsen. Going by the trend, Trump is unlikely to budge from his decision and the nuclear deal might not make it through the next year. Such circumstances are likely to aggravate tensions to quite an extent.Defense Stocks on a TearDefense heavyweights such as Lockheed Martin, Raytheon (RTN), Boeing, Northrop Grumman (NOC) and General Dynamics (GD) have rallied since Trump’s annulment of the deal. Between May 8 and May 11, shares of these giants have gained 1.4%, 2.6%, 1%, 1.7% and 2.4%, respectively, on the back of geopolitical uncertainties associated with such developments.Defense contractors with significant exposure to the Middle East are poised to gain immensely from international tensions that are flaring up. Such companies will capitalize on increased orders for missile defense and tactical missile systems along with increased demand for ships and other aircraft equipment.4 Hot ChoicesWith escalating international tensions and the unlikelihood of a reversal in Trump’s decision, it's not difficult to imagine why defense stocks might get a shot in the arm. In this context, we have selected four stocks that are expected to gain from these factors. These four stocks carry a Zacks Rank # 2 (Buy). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.L3 Technologies, Inc. (LLL  -  Free Report) is a provider of aerospace systems, communication, electronic, and sensor systems for military purposes as well as homeland security.The company is based out of New York. The expected earnings growth rate for the current year is 13.78%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for the current year has improved 1.9% over the past 60 days. L3 Technologies has gained 5.9% in the past six months.Lockheed Martin Corporation (LMT  -  Free Report) engages in research, design, development and manufacture of aerospace systems and products.The company is based out of Bethesda. The expected earnings growth rate for the current year is 19.70%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for the current year has improved 2.7% over the past 60 days. Lockheed has gained 3.4% in the past six months.The Boeing Company (BA  -  Free Report) engages in designing, developing, manufacturing and supporting commercial jetliners, military aircraft, satellites, missile defense, human space flight, and launch systems.The company is based out of Chicago. The expected earnings growth rate for the current year is 20.80%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for the current year has improved 3.5% over the past 60 days. Boeing has gained 31.4% in the past six months.TransDigm Group Incorporated (TDG  -  Free Report) is a designer, producer, and supplier of aircraft components for both military as well as commercial purposes.The company is based out of Cleveland. The expected earnings growth rate for the current year is 41.95%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for the current year has improved 1.4% over the past 60 days. Boeing has gained 25.3% in the past six months.Looking for Stocks with Skyrocketing Upside?Zacks has just released a Special Report on the booming investment opportunities of legal marijuana.Ignited by new referendums and legislation, this industry is expected to blast from an already robust $6.7 billion to $20.2 billion in 2021. It has been about a month since the last earnings report for Transdigm Group Incorporated (TDG  -  Free Report). Shares have lost about 1.74% in that time frame.Will the recent negative trend continue leading up to its next earnings release, or is TDG due for a breakout? Before we dive into how investors and analysts have reacted as of late, let's take a quick look at its most recent earnings report in order to get a better handle on the important catalysts.TransDigm's Q1 Earnings Impressive, Revenues BeatTransDigm reported first-quarter fiscal 2018 adjusted earnings of $5.58 per share, which reflected growth of a whopping 121.4% year over year. The bottom line gained from the favorable impact of the recent tax reforms.Decent top-line growth and improvements in the operating margin also drove earnings. In addition, continued efforts to boost productivity, lower refinancing costs as well as lower acquisition-related costs proved conducive to earnings growth. This was partially offset by higher interest outlay.Inside the HeadlinesNet sales for the reported quarter amounted to $848 million, reflecting year-over-year growth of 4.2%. However, the top line missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $862 million.Decent growth in Commercial Aftermarket (up 10% year over year) revenues supplemented the top-line performance. Furthermore, contributions from the previously-completed acquisitions boosted the overall sales performance during the fiscal first quarter. TransDigm’s commercial aftermarket transport business witnessed solid year-over-year revenue growth. However, Defense and Commercial OEM remained flat year over year.TransDigm’s EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization) grew 18.4% year over year to $382.5 million.During fiscal 2017, TransDigm had announced the acquisition of three add-on aerospace product lines, for a total consideration of roughly $100 million. These product lines mainly comprise proprietary, sole-source products with significant aftermarket content. The product lines are in sync with the company’s long-term plan and highlight its strategy to acquire proprietary aerospace businesses with significant aftermarket content, in a bid to fortify its core business.The acquired business lines have combined revenues of about $32 million and will be consolidated into TransDigm’s existing businesses. The company financed the acquisitions through existing cash on hand.These acquisitions will add to TransDigm’s product range with the proprietary products which enjoy strong positions on high use of platforms, robust aftermarket content and an excellent reputation. Products offered include highly engineered aerospace controls, quick disconnect couplings, as well as communication electronics.LiquidityTransDigm ended the fiscal first quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $857.9 million, up from $650.6 million as of Sep 30, 2017. At the end of the reported quarter, the company’s long-term debt was $11.4 billion, nearly flat compared with the figure recorded at the end of September 2017.Fiscal 2018 GuidanceConcurrent with the fiscal first-quarter results, the company reiterated its revenue outlook and revised its earnings guidance for fiscal 2018, to incorporate the new tax regulations. Adjusted earnings per share are now forecast to be in the band of $16.95-$17.59 per share, in comparison to the earlier guided range of $12.78-$13.42 per share. The company had generated earnings of $12.38 per share in fiscal 2017.Sales are expected to lie in the range of $3,645-$3,725 million (compared with $3,504 million reported in fiscal 2017). The fiscal 2018 guidance assumes that commercial aftermarket and OEM revenues will grow in the mid-single-digit percentage range, while defense revenues will be up in the low- to mid-single-digit percentage range.Estimated net income from continuing operations lies in the band of $906-$942 million, up from the earlier projection of $702-$738 million, while EBITDA is likely to be in the range of $1,805-$1,855 million.How Have Estimates Been Moving Since Then?In the past month, investors have witnessed an upward trend in fresh estimates. There have been four revisions higher for the current quarter compared to one lower. In the past month, the consensus estimate has shifted by 15.21% due to these changes.Transdigm Group Incorporated Price and Consensus Transdigm Group Incorporated Price and Consensus | Transdigm Group Incorporated QuoteVGM ScoresCurrently, TDG has a subpar Growth Score of D, however its Momentum is doing a lot better with an A. However, the stock was allocated a grade of D on the value side, putting it in the bottom 40% for this investment strategy.Overall, the stock has an aggregate VGM Score of C. If you aren't focused on one strategy, this score is the one you should be interested in.The company's stock is suitable solely for momentum based on our styles scores.OutlookEstimates have been broadly trending upward for the stock and the magnitude of these revisions looks promising. It comes with little surprise TDG has a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). We expect an above average return from the stock in the next few months.

TransDigm Group Incorporated (TDG  -  Free Report) reported second-quarter fiscal 2018 adjusted earnings of $3.79 per share, growing an impressive 25.1% year over year. The bottom line gained from the favorable impact of the recent tax reforms.Decent top-line growth and improvements in operating margin also drove earnings. In addition, continued efforts to boost productivity, lower refinancing costs as well as lower acquisition-related costs proved conducive to earnings growth. This was partially offset by higher interest outlay.Inside the HeadlinesNet sales for the reported quarter amounted to $933.1 million, reflecting year-over-year growth of 7.4%. Organic sales grew 6.6%.Decent growth in Commercial Aftermarket revenues supplemented the top-line performance. Furthermore, contributions from the previously-completed acquisitions boosted overall sales performance during the fiscal second quarter.TransDigm’s EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization) grew 9.8% year over year to $463.1 million.Transdigm Group Incorporated Price, Consensus and EPS Surprise  Transdigm Group Incorporated Price, Consensus and EPS Surprise | Transdigm Group Incorporated QuoteAcquisitions & DivestituresTransDigm frequently acquires proprietary aerospace businesses with significant aftermarket content, which boosts its footprint in its core market and is in line with its operating strategies. During the quarter, it acquired the Kirkhill engineered elastomers business from Esterline Corporation for $50 million. The Kirkhill business makes specialty seals and other rubber components meant primarily for aerospace and defense markets.Also, TransDigm completed the sale of Schroth to a private equity fund and certain members of Schroth management for approximately $61 million.In fiscal 2017, TransDigm had announced the acquisition of three add-on aerospace product lines for a total consideration of roughly $100 million. These product lines mainly comprise proprietary, sole-source products with significant aftermarket content. The product lines are in sync with the company’s long-term plan and highlight its strategy to acquire proprietary aerospace businesses with significant aftermarket content, in a bid to fortify its core business.The acquired business lines have combined revenues of about $32 million and will be consolidated into TransDigm’s existing businesses. The company financed the acquisitions through existing cash on hand.These acquisitions will add to TransDigm’s product range with the proprietary products, which enjoy strong position on high use of platforms, robust aftermarket content and an excellent reputation. Products offered include highly engineered aerospace controls, quick disconnect couplings, as well as communication electronics.LiquidityTransDigm ended the fiscal second quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $1,011 million, up from $650.6 million as of Sep 30, 2017. At the end of the reported quarter, the company’s long-term debt was $11.4 billion, nearly flat compared with the figure recorded at the end of September 2017.Fiscal 2018 GuidanceConcurrent with the fiscal second-quarter results, the company raised its revenue and earnings guidance for fiscal 2018 to incorporate the impressive operating performance so far in fiscal 2018, new tax regulations and recent acquisitions. Adjusted earnings per share are now forecast to be in the band of $17.35-$17.99 per share compared with the earlier guided range of $16.95-$17.59 per share. The company had generated earnings of $12.38 per share in fiscal 2017.Sales are now expected to be in the range of $3,740-$3,820 million (compared with $3,645-$3,725 million guided earlier). Net income from continuing operations is estimated in the band of $902-$938 million, compared with the earlier projection of $906-$942 million, while EBITDA is likely to be in the range of $1,830-$1,880 million.Our TakeTransDigm’s thriving commercial aftermarket business proved to be a strong growth driver for its fiscal second-quarter results. The aftermarket business comprises 55% of sales, but typically makes up more than 75% of the company’s EBITDA. This translates into consistent revenue generation capacity through all phases of the aerospace cycle. The aftermarket business is expanding as majority of the aircraft bought during the financial crisis are beginning to age, and require more frequent and comprehensive servicing.We believe stable aftermarkets, which have historically produced higher gross margins, will continue to drive financial performance in the upcoming quarters.However, softness in business jet, helicopter and freighter revenues, have been hurting the company’s profits. In addition to this, weakness in the global macroeconomic conditions is affecting air travel, adding to the company’s woes. The company is concerned about the future of the commercial transport industry. TransDigm Group Incorporated (TDG  -  Free Report) reported first-quarter fiscal 2018 adjusted earnings of $5.58 per share, which reflected growth of a whopping 121.4% year over year. The bottom line gained from the favorable impact of the recent tax reforms.Decent top-line growth and improvements in the operating margin also drove earnings. In addition, continued efforts to boost productivity, lower refinancing costs as well as lower acquisition-related costs proved conducive to earnings growth. This was partially offset by higher interest outlay.Inside the HeadlinesNet sales for the reported quarter amounted to $848 million, reflecting year-over-year growth of 4.2%. However, the top line missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $862 million.Decent growth in Commercial Aftermarket (up 10% year over year) revenues supplemented the top-line performance. Furthermore, contributions from the previously-completed acquisitions boosted the overall sales performance during the fiscal first quarter. TransDigm’s commercial aftermarket transport business witnessed solid year-over-year revenue growth. However, Defense and Commercial OEM remained flat year over year.TransDigm’s EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization) grew 18.4% year over year to $382.5 million.Transdigm Group Incorporated Price, Consensus and EPS Surprise Transdigm Group Incorporated Price, Consensus and EPS Surprise | Transdigm Group Incorporated QuoteDuring fiscal 2017, TransDigm had announced the acquisition of three add-on aerospace product lines, for a total consideration of roughly $100 million. These product lines mainly comprise proprietary, sole-source products with significant aftermarket content. The product lines are in sync with the company’s long-term plan and highlight its strategy to acquire proprietary aerospace businesses with significant aftermarket content, in a bid to fortify its core business.The acquired business lines have combined revenues of about $32 million and will be consolidated into TransDigm’s existing businesses. The company financed the acquisitions through existing cash on hand.These acquisitions will add to TransDigm’s product range with the proprietary products which enjoy strong positions on high use of platforms, robust aftermarket content and an excellent reputation. Products offered include highly engineered aerospace controls, quick disconnect couplings, as well as communication electronics.LiquidityTransDigm ended the fiscal first quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $857.9 million, up from $650.6 million as of Sep 30, 2017. At the end of the reported quarter, the company’s long-term debt was $11.4 billion, nearly flat compared with the figure recorded at the end of September 2017.Fiscal 2018 GuidanceConcurrent with the fiscal first-quarter results, the company reiterated its revenue outlook and revised its earnings guidance for fiscal 2018, to incorporate the new tax regulations. Adjusted earnings per share are now forecast to be in the band of $16.95-$17.59 per share, in comparison to the earlier guided range of $12.78-$13.42 per share. The company had generated earnings of $12.38 per share in fiscal 2017.Sales are expected to lie in the range of $3,645-$3,725 million (compared with $3,504 million reported in fiscal 2017). The fiscal 2018 guidance assumes that commercial aftermarket and OEM revenues will grow in the mid-single-digit percentage range, while defense revenues will be up in the low- to mid-single-digit percentage range.Estimated net income from continuing operations lies in the band of $906-$942 million, up from the earlier projection of $702-$738 million, while EBITDA is likely to be in the range of $1,805-$1,855 million.Our TakeTransDigm’s thriving commercial aftermarket business proved to be a strong growth driver for its fiscal first-quarter results. The aftermarket business comprises 55% of sales, but typically makes up more than 75% of the company’s EBITDA. This translates into consistent revenue-generation capacity through all phases of the aerospace cycle. The aftermarket business is expanding as majority of aircraft bought during the financial crisis is beginning to age, and requires more frequent and comprehensive servicing.We believe stable aftermarkets, which have historically produced higher gross margins, will continue to drive financial performance for the upcoming quarters.However, softness in business jet, helicopter and freighter revenues, have been hurting the company’s profits. In addition to this, weakness in the global macroeconomic conditions is affecting air travel, adding to the company’s woes. The company is concerned about the commercial transport industry for the coming times as well. These factors can play spoilsport for this Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) company in the near term.Stocks to ConsiderSome better-ranked stocks in the industry include Spirit Aerosystems Holdings, Inc. (SPR  -  Free Report), Raytheon Company (RTN  -  Free Report) and Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (TDY  -  Free Report). While Spirit Aerosystems sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), Raytheon and Teledyne carry a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.Spirit Aerosystems surpassed earnings estimates twice in the trailing four quarters, resulting in an average surprise of 9.8%.Raytheon has managed to beat estimates each time over the preceding four quarters, for a positive earnings surprise of 6.4%.Teledyne Technologies has a positive average earnings surprise of 35.4% for same time period, beating estimates strongly all through.More Stock News: This Is Bigger than the iPhone!                   It could become the mother of all technological revolutions. Designed to provide broad exposure to the Industrials ETFs category of the U.S. equity market, the Guggenheim S&P 500 Equal Weight Industrials ETF (RGI  -  Free Report) is a smart beta exchange traded fund launched on 11/01/2006.What Are Smart Beta ETFs?Market cap weighted indexes were created to reflect the market, or a specific segment of the market, and the ETF industry has traditionally been dominated by products based on this strategy.Because market cap weighted indexes provide a low-cost, convenient, and transparent way of replicating market returns, they work well for investors who believe in market efficiency.There are some investors, though, who think it's possible to beat the market with great stock selection; this group likely invests in another class of funds known as smart beta, which track non-cap weighted strategies.Non-cap weighted indexes try to choose stocks that have a better chance of risk-return performance, which is based on specific fundamental characteristics, or a mix of other such characteristics.While this space offers a number of choices to investors, including simplest equal-weighting, fundamental weighting and volatility/momentum based weighting methodologies, not all these strategies have been able to deliver superior results.Fund Sponsor & IndexBecause the fund has amassed over $307.48 M, this makes it one of the average sized ETFs in the Industrials ETFs. RGI is managed by Invesco Powershares. RGI seeks to match the performance of the S&P 500 Equal Weight Industrials Index before fees and expenses.This index is an unmanaged equal weighted version of the S&P 500 Industrials Index that consists of the common stocks of the following industries: aerospace & defense, building products, construction & engineering, electrical equipment, conglomerates, machinery; commercial services & supplies, air freight & logistics, airlines, marine, road & rail transportation infrastructure.Cost & Other ExpensesExpense ratios are an important factor in the return of an ETF and in the long-term, cheaper funds can significantly outperform their more expensive cousins, other things remaining the same.Operating expenses on an annual basis are 0.40% for this ETF, which makes it on par with most peer products in the space.RGI's 12-month trailing dividend yield is 1.17%.Sector Exposure and Top HoldingsIt is important to delve into an ETF's holdings before investing despite the many upsides to these kinds of funds like diversified exposure, which minimizes single stock risk. And, most ETFs are very transparent products that disclose their holdings on a daily basis.Representing 100% of the portfolio, the fund has heaviest allocation to the Industrials sector.Taking into account individual holdings, Transdigm Group Inc (TDG  -  Free Report) accounts for about 1.57% of the fund's total assets, followed by Ww Grainger Inc (GWW  -  Free Report) and Harris Corp (HRS  -  Free Report).RGI's top 10 holdings account for about 15.26% of its total assets under management.Performance and RiskRGI has added roughly 0.21% so far this year, and as of 04/18/2018, is up about 18.09% in the last one year. In the past 52-week period, the fund has traded between $102.86 and $127.83.RGI has a beta of 1.09 and standard deviation of 14.80% for the trailing three-year period, which makes the fund a medium choice in the space. With about 70 holdings, it effectively diversifies company-specific risk.AlternativesGuggenheim S&P 500 Equal Weight Industrials ETF is an excellent option for investors seeking to outperform the Industrials ETFs segment of the market. There are other ETFs in the space which investors could consider as well.Vanguard Industrials ETF (VIS  -  Free Report) tracks MSCI US Investable Market Industrials 25/50 Index and the Industrial Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLI  -  Free Report) tracks Industrial Select Sector Index. Vanguard Industrials ETF has $3.80 B in assets, Industrial Select Sector SPDR Fund has $12.79 B. VIS has an expense ratio of 0.10% and XLI charges 0.13%.Investors looking for cheaper and lower-risk options should consider traditional market cap weighted ETFs that aim to match the returns of the Industrials ETFs.Bottom LineTo learn more about this product and other ETFs, screen for products that match your investment objectives and read articles on latest developments in the ETF investing universe, please visit Zacks ETF Center.

TransDigm Group Inc. (TDG  -  Free Report) has managed to impress investors with its recent earnings streak, wherein the company’s bottom line has trumped estimates thrice in the trailing four quarters. TransDigm’s impressive business model actively works toward strengthening and enhancing its position in highly-engineered proprietary aerospace components’ niche markets.We believe that the company’s strong operational execution, solid portfolio of products as well as complementary acquisitions should continue boosting growth, moving ahead.Consequently, TransDigm’s shares have had an impressive run on the bourse over the past six months. The stock has gained 16.3%, compared with the industry’s rally of 9.5%. We expect the company’s remarkable traction across markets to continue in the upcoming quarters as well. Given this backdrop, let’s delve deeper to find out key drivers for the company right now.Factors to ConsiderTransDigm’s business operation model is driven by three value driver concepts has helped the company generate sufficient organic and inorganic growth, and drive operating margin expansion over the past few quarters. Also, it designs, produces and supplies highly engineered proprietary aerospace components and certain systems with a significant aftermarket presence. In this regard, 90% of TransDigm’s net sales are generated from proprietary engineered products, for which the company enjoys the intellectual property right, thus enhancing its competitive strength meaningfully.Moreover, the company’s penchant for acquisitions of proprietary aerospace businesses with significant aftermarket content has helped it to bolster footprint in core market and grab a higher market share. In fiscal 2017, TransDigm acquired three add-on aerospace product lines, for a total consideration of roughly $100 million.These acquisitions should add to its product range with the proprietary products, which already enjoy strong positions on high use of platforms and robust aftermarket content. Further, its Defense business has been experiencing stability, thus adding to the company’s strength.Also, decentralized organizational structure and a unique compensation system for senior management have created a potent workforce that acts as one of the company’s major assets. This apart, a diversified revenue base reduces TransDigm’s dependence on any particular product, platform or market channel, thus playing a crucial role in maintaining its financial performance.However, the company is suffering from escalating debt burden and consequent higher interest expenses. Its interest expenses have also been trending upward for the past few quarters. For instance, TransDigm recorded an interest expense of about $15 million, up 10% from the previous quarter, mainly on account of increase in its total debt. We believe that rising interest expenses will continue restraining its profits, going ahead.This apart, the Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) company has been suffering from prolonged weakness in some of its major end market that has thwarted the company’s growth momentum. Softening discretionary retrofits, interior retrofits and weakness in jet and helicopter markets have also impacted its top-line performance in recent times.Key PicksSome better-ranked stocks from the same space include Curtiss-Wright Corp. (CW  -  Free Report), Raytheon Company (RTN  -  Free Report) and Rockwell Collins, Inc. (COL  -  Free Report). While Curtiss-Wright sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), Raytheon and Rockwell Collins carry a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.Curtiss-Wright surpassed estimates in the trailing four quarters, with an average positive earnings surprise of 15.1%.Raytheon surpassed estimates in the trailing four quarters, with an average positive earnings surprise of 6.4%.Rockwell Collins outpaced estimates thrice in the preceding four quarters, with an average earnings surprise of 2.5%.Investor Alert: Breakthroughs PendingA medical advance is now at the flashpoint between theory and realization. Billions of dollars in research have poured into it. Companies are already generating substantial revenue, and even more wondrous products are in the pipeline.Cures for a variety of deadly diseases are in sight, and so are big potential profits for early investors.
